critique: This document pertains to the National Industrial Recovery Act during the Franklin D. Roosevelt administration. It approves the Mason Contractors Chapter of the Code of Fair Competition for the Construction Industry. Given the context of the New Deal era, the document likely reflects a liberal approach to economic regulation and a strong federal role in managing the economy. There is no information related to immigration, executive power, national security, or social inclusion. Therefore, those axes will be scored as neutral. The document centralizes power at the federal level.
